Normal.text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
Normal.author: John Lennon

Normal.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
Normal.author: Oscar Wilde

Normal.text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned discontinuation about life: it goes on.
Normal.author: Robert Frost

Normal.text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
Normal.author: Oscar Wilde

Normal.text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
Normal.author: Albert Einstein

Normal.text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
Normal.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Normal.text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
Normal.author: Mae West

Normal.text: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
Normal.author: Helen Keller

Normal.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Normal.author: Socrates

Normal.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
Normal.author: Confucius

Normal.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Normal.author: Nelson Mandela

Normal.text: Life is short, and it is up to you to make it sweet.
Normal.author: Sarah Louise Delany

Normal.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Normal.author: Steve Jobs

Normal.text: Not all those who wander are lost.
Normal.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Normal.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Normal.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Normal.text: Life is a journey, not a destination.
Normal.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Normal.text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
Normal.author: Dalai Lama

Normal.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
Normal.author: Peter Drucker

Normal.text: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
Normal.author: Charles R. Swindoll

Normal.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
Normal.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Normal.text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Normal.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Normal.text: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
Normal.author: Walter Bagehot

Normal.text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
Normal.author: Helen Keller

Normal.text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
Normal.author: David Viscott

Normal.text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
Normal.author: Jordan Belfort

Normal.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
Normal.author: Anais Nin

Normal.text: The best revenge is massive success.
Normal.author: Frank Sinatra

Normal.text: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
Normal.author: Maya Angelou

Normal.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
Normal.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Normal.text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
Normal.author: George Addair

Normal.text: Life is like a Wi-Fi signal—just when you think you're connected, it drops.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
Normal.author: Buddha

Normal.text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Normal.author: Aristotle

Normal.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Normal.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Normal.text: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
Normal.author: Sholom Aleichem

Normal.text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
Normal.author: Plato

Normal.text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
Normal.author: Soren Kierkegaard

Normal.text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
Normal.author: Abraham Lincoln

Normal.text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
Normal.author: Henry Ford

Normal.text: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow.
Normal.author: Lao Tzu

Normal.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
Normal.author: Chinese Proverb

Normal.text: You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
Normal.author: C.S. Lewis

Normal.text: Life is about making an impact, not making an income.
Normal.author: Kevin Kruse

Normal.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Normal.author: Socrates

Normal.text: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.
Normal.author: Victor Hugo

Normal.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
Normal.author: Lao Tzu

Normal.text: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
Normal.author: Grandma Moses

Normal.text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
Normal.author: Alan Watts

Normal.text: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
Normal.author: Oprah Winfrey

Normal.text: Life is a balance of holding on and letting go.
Normal.author: Rumi

Normal.text: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
Normal.author: Oprah Winfrey

Normal.text: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
Normal.author: Danny Kaye

Normal.text: The only thing that is constant is change.
Normal.author: Heraclitus

Normal.text: Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
Normal.author: George Bernard Shaw

Normal.text: The best way out is always through.
Normal.author: Robert Frost

Normal.text: Life is a mystery to be lived, not a problem to be solved.
Normal.author: Adrienne Rich

Normal.text: The greatest risk is to risk nothing at all.
Normal.author: Leo Buscaglia

Normal.text: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
Normal.author: Oscar Wilde

Normal.text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
Normal.author: Tony Robbins

Normal.text: Life is a book and there are a thousand pages I have not yet read.
Normal.author: Cassandra Clare

Normal.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
Normal.author: Dalai Lama

Normal.text: Life is a daring adventure or nothing.
Normal.author: Helen Keller

Normal.text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
Normal.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

Normal.text: Life is not about waiting for the storm to pass, but learning to dance in the rain.
Normal.author: Vivian Greene

Normal.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
Normal.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Normal.text: Life is a succession of moments, to live each one is to succeed.
Normal.author: Corita Kent

Normal.text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Normal.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Normal.text: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
Normal.author: Ernest Holmes

Normal.text: The only source of knowledge is experience.
Normal.author: Albert Einstein

Normal.text: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
Normal.author: Tony Robbins

Normal.text: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
Normal.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Normal.text: Life is a puzzle; you have to find the pieces to complete it.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle.
Normal.author: Storm Jameson

Normal.text: Life is a song - sing it.
Normal.author: Sai Baba

Normal.text: The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
Normal.author: William James

Normal.text: Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
Normal.author: Jean Racine

Normal.text: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
Normal.author: Ginger Rogers

Normal.text: Life is a series of collisions with the future.
Normal.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

Normal.text: The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.
Normal.author: Henry Ford

Normal.text: Life is a progress, and not a station.
Normal.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Normal.text: The only disability in life is a bad attitude.
Normal.author: Scott Hamilton

Normal.text: Life is a challenge, meet it!
Normal.author: Sai Baba

Normal.text: The greatest adventure is what lies ahead.
Normal.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Normal.text: Life is a dream, realize it.
Normal.author: Sai Baba

Normal.text: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
Normal.author: Chuck Palahniuk

Normal.text: Life is a game, play it.
Normal.author: Sai Baba

Normal.text: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
Normal.author: Elbert Hubbard

Normal.text: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
Normal.author: Charlie Chaplin

Normal.text: The only thing in life achieved without effort is failure.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: Life is a work of art, you have to paint it colorful!
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: The greatest freedom is to be free of our own mind.
Normal.author: Osho

Normal.text: Life is a canvas of many colors, paint it well.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: The only way to live a meaningful life is to live it with purpose.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: Life is a story, make yours the best seller.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: The greatest joy in life is to love and be loved.
Normal.author: George Sand

Normal.text: Life is a gift, never take it for granted.
Normal.author: Unknown

Normal.text: The only way to find the limits of the possible is by going beyond them into the impossible.
Normal.author: Arthur C. Clarke

Normal.text: Life is a journey to be experienced, not a problem to be solved.
Normal.author: Winnie the Pooh

Historical.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
Historical.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Historical.text: That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.
Historical.author: Neil Armstrong

Historical.text: Ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.
Historical.author: John F. Kennedy

Historical.text: I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed.
Historical.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Historical.text: We shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds.
Historical.author: Winston Churchill

Historical.text: In the name of God, go!
Historical.author: Oliver Cromwell

Historical.text: Give me liberty, or give me death!
Historical.author: Patrick Henry

Historical.text: I came, I saw, I conquered.
Historical.author: Julius Caesar

Historical.text: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
Historical.author: George Santayana

Historical.text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Historical.author: Edmund Burke

Historical.text: History is a set of lies agreed upon.
Historical.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Historical.text: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.
Historical.author: Theodore Parker

Historical.text: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
Historical.author: Louisa May Alcott

Historical.text: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth.
Historical.author: Abraham Lincoln

Historical.text: We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal.
Historical.author: Thomas Jefferson

Historical.text: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
Historical.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of a few men who had faith in themselves.
Historical.author: Swami Vivekananda

Historical.text: A nation that forgets its past has no future.
Historical.author: Winston Churchill

Historical.text: The past is never dead. It's not even past.
Historical.author: William Faulkner

Historical.text: We are not makers of history. We are made by history.
Historical.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Historical.text: History is written by the victors.
Historical.author: Winston Churchill

Historical.text: The only thing new in the world is the history you do not know.
Historical.author: Harry S. Truman

Historical.text: Those who do not learn history are doomed to repeat it.
Historical.author: George Santayana

Historical.text: History is a vast early warning system.
Historical.author: Norman Cousins

Historical.text: The history of the world is but the biography of great men.
Historical.author: Thomas Carlyle

Historical.text: To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.
Historical.author: Cicero

Historical.text: History is a cyclic poem written by time upon the memories of man.
Historical.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

Historical.text: The life of man is of no greater duration than the breath of his nostrils.
Historical.author: Plato

Historical.text: History is a gallery of pictures in which there are few originals and many copies.
Historical.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

Historical.text: The history of all hitherto existing society is the history of class struggles.
Historical.author: Karl Marx

Historical.text: Mankind are governed more by their feelings than by reason.
Historical.author: Samuel Adams

Historical.text: History is a race between education and catastrophe.
Historical.author: H.G. Wells

Historical.text: The first duty of a man is to think for himself.
Historical.author: Jose Marti

Historical.text: History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.
Historical.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

Historical.text: The history of the world is none other than the progress of the consciousness of freedom.
Historical.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

Historical.text: History is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake.
Historical.author: James Joyce

Historical.text: The only way to understand the present is to study the past.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is philosophy teaching by examples.
Historical.author: Thucydides

Historical.text: The history of mankind is of two kinds: the history of those who were free and the history of those who were slaves.
Historical.author: Voltaire

Historical.text: History is a pack of lies about events that never happened told by people who weren't there.
Historical.author: George Santayana

Historical.text: The history of the world is the record of a man in quest of his daily bread and butter.
Historical.author: Hendrik Willem van Loon

Historical.text: History is the unfolding of miscalculations.
Historical.author: Barbara Tuchman

Historical.text: The history of the world is the judgement of the world.
Historical.author: Friedrich Schiller

Historical.text: History is a relentless master. It has no present, only the past rushing into the future.
Historical.author: John F. Kennedy

Historical.text: The history of liberty is a history of resistance.
Historical.author: Woodrow Wilson

Historical.text: History is the story of events, with praise or blame.
Historical.author: Cotton Mather

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few.
Historical.author: Thomas Carlyle

Historical.text: History is a vision of God's creation on the move.
Historical.author: Arnold J. Toynbee

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the triumph of the heartless over the mindless.
Historical.author: Sir Harold Nicolson

Historical.text: History is the autobiography of a madman.
Historical.author: Alexander Herzen

Historical.text: The history of the world is but the biography of great men.
Historical.author: Thomas Carlyle

Historical.text: History is a symphony of echoes heard and unheard.
Historical.author: Charles A. Beard

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the courage to stand up.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a guide to navigation in perilous times.
Historical.author: David McCullough

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the struggle between the haves and the have-nots.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a series of victories won by the scientific man over the romantic man.
Historical.author: H.L. Mencken

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to dream.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the incessant struggle of humanity against ignorance and oppression.
Historical.author: Helen Keller

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the vision to see beyond their time.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story written by the finger of God.
Historical.author: C.S. Lewis

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the struggle for freedom.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a mirror of the past and a lamp for the future.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who changed it.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a tale told by the survivors.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the courage to act.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the triumphs and tragedies of humanity.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to be different.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a lesson in humility.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the vision to lead.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human spirit.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to dream big.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human struggle for freedom and justice.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who changed the course of events.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human journey through time.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the courage to stand up for what is right.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human spirit in action.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to challenge the status quo.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human struggle for progress.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the vision to see a better future.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human quest for meaning.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to make a difference.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human struggle for truth.
Historical.author: diagonalizeUnknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the courage to fight for justice.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human spirit in triumph.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to dream of a better world.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human struggle for freedom.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the vision to change the world.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human journey through adversity.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to stand up for what they believed in.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human struggle for equality.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the courage to lead the way.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human spirit in pursuit of truth.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to challenge the impossible.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a record of the human struggle for justice.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who had the vision to see beyond the horizon.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: History is a story of the human quest for freedom.
Historical.author: Unknown

Historical.text: The history of the world is the history of the few who dared to dream of a better future.
Historical.author: Unknown

Inspirational.text: Your time is limited, don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
Inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

Inspirational.text: The best way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Inspirational.author: Walt Disney

Inspirational.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Inspirational.author: Winston Churchill

Inspirational.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
Inspirational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
Inspirational.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Inspirational.author: Confucius

Inspirational.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
Inspirational.author: C.S. Lewis

Inspirational.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
Inspirational.author: Zig Ziglar

Inspirational.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
Inspirational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Inspirational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

Inspirational.text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
Inspirational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
Inspirational.author: Wayne Gretzky

Inspirational.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
Inspirational.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Inspirational.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
Inspirational.author: Albert Einstein

Inspirational.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
Inspirational.author: Chinese Proverb

Inspirational.text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Inspirational.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Inspirational.text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
Inspirational.author: Sam Levenson

Inspirational.text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
Inspirational.author: Charles Kingsleigh

Inspirational.text: Success is not the absence of obstacles, but the courage to push through them.
Inspirational.author: Unknown

Inspirational.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Inspirational.author: Nelson Mandela

Inspirational.text: Dream big and dare to fail.
Inspirational.author: Norman Vaughan

Inspirational.text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself.
Inspirational.author: Jordan Belfort

Inspirational.text: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
Inspirational.author: Vince Lombardi

Inspirational.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Inspirational.author: Walt Disney

Inspirational.text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
Inspirational.author: Walt Disney

Inspirational.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
Inspirational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
Inspirational.author: Zig Ziglar

Inspirational.text: The future depends on what you do today.
Inspirational.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Inspirational.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Inspirational.author: Winston Churchill

Inspirational.text: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.
Inspirational.author: Arthur C. Clarke

Inspirational.text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
Inspirational.author: Christian D. Larson

Inspirational.text: Don’t let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
Inspirational.author: John Wooden

Inspirational.text: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
Inspirational.author: Harry Golden

Inspirational.text: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
Inspirational.author: Booker T. Washington

Inspirational.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

Inspirational.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
Inspirational.author: C.S. Lewis

Inspirational.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
Inspirational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
Inspirational.author: Peter Drucker

Inspirational.text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
Inspirational.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Inspirational.text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.

Inspirational.author: Jordan Belfort

Inspirational.author: Charles Kingsleigh

Inspirational.text: Success is not the absence of obstacles, but the courage to push through them.
Inspirational.author: Unknown

Inspirational.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Inspirational.author: Nelson Mandela

Inspirational.text: Dream big and dare to fail.
Inspirational.author: Norman Vaughan

Inspirational.text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself.
Inspirational.author: Jordan Belfort

Inspirational.text: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
Inspirational.author: Vince Lombardi

Inspirational.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Inspirational.author: Walt Disney

Inspirational.text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
Inspirational.author: Walt Disney

Inspirational.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
Inspirational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
Inspirational.author: Zig Ziglar

Inspirational.text: The future depends on what you do today.
Inspirational.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Inspirational.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Inspirational.author: Winston Churchill

Inspirational.text: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.
Inspirational.author: Arthur C. Clarke

Inspirational.text: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
Inspirational.author: Christian D. Larson

Inspirational.text: Don’t let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
Inspirational.author: John Wooden

Inspirational.text: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
Inspirational.author: Harry Golden

Inspirational.text: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
Inspirational.author: Booker T. Washington

Inspirational.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

Inspirational.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
Inspirational.author: C.S. Lewis

Inspirational.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
Inspirational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Inspirational.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
Inspirational.author: Peter Drucker

Inspirational.text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
Inspirational.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Inspirational.text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
